paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.224T>C (p.Leu75Pro) associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband was a 28-year-old female... she was finally diagnosed as HCM by echocardiography and cardiac MRI.
Both her mother (II-2) and younger brother (III-3) died suddenly of HCM...
Both her mother (II-2) and younger brother (III-3) died suddenly of HCM...
Her second and third uncles (II-3; II-4) reported themselves as healthy.
Her second and third uncles (II-3; II-4) reported themselves as healthy.
Her father's (II-1) and daughter’s (IV-1) health status was unknown.
Her father's (II-1) and daughter’s (IV-1) health status was unknown.

functional_data.summary: The p.Leu75Pro mutation is predicted to be deleterious by in silico prediction algorithms.
assays: in silico prediction algorithms (SIFT, PolyPhen2, MutationTaster)

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family; the mother and brother were affected.
variants.population_frequency: Not recorded in gnomAD and ExAC databases.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on pathogenic classification and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is classified as pathogenic according to published standards and guidelines by the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics.
key_quotes: The heterozygous variant c.224T > C is located in exon 3 of the TTR gene.
This heterozygous genotype is considered diagnostic.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
